abstract: A new poll shows that New York State residents are almost evenly divided on natural gas drilling. Opposition is stronger upstate, but the question remains whether it is potent enough for New York to do what no state has done: turn away the gas industry's favored technology.
snippet: A new poll shows that New York State residents are almost evenly divided on natural gas drilling. Opposition is stronger upstate, but the question remains whether it is potent enough for New York to do what no state has done: turn away the gas...
lead_paragraph: Like the blind man and the elephant, the politics of gas drilling depend a lot on where you look.

headline.main: The Fracking Divide: Who Will Prevail in N.Y.?
